# Original Dataframe

```{r}
df <- readr::read_csv(here::here("data", "full-data-uk-challenge.csv"))
```

# Plot Original Predictions

```{r}
model <- "epiforecasts-EpiExpert"
location <- "GB"
plot_quantiles(df, model, location, quantiles = c(0.01, 0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95, 0.99))
```

# Update Predictions

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# takes a bit of time
df_list <- update_predictions(methods = c("cqr", "qsa_uniform"), model, location, cv_init_training = 0.5)
df_combined_1 <- collect_predictions(df_list)
```

# Numerical Analysis

```{r}
# use prefitted data
uk_cqr_qsa <- readr::read_rds(here::here("data_results", "uk_cqr_qsa_uniform.rds"))
```

```{r}
uk_cqr_qsa |>
  scoringutils::score() |>
  scoringutils::summarise_scores(by = c("method", "model", "target_type")) |>
  dplyr::arrange(target_type, desc(method))
```

# Graphical Analysis

## for given `model`, `location`, `target_type`, `quantile` and `horizon`

```{r}
plot_intervals(uk_cqr_qsa, model, location, target_type = "Cases", quantile = 0.05, horizon = 1)
```

## for given `model`, `location` and `quantile` and different `horizons`

```{r}
plot_intervals_grid(uk_cqr_qsa, model, facet_by = "horizon", highlight_cv = TRUE)
```

## for given `model`, `location` and `horizon` and different `quantiles`

```{r}
plot_intervals_grid(uk_cqr_qsa, model, facet_by = "quantile", highlight_cv = TRUE)
```
